Hydras continue Monitoring the situation in the ark.


From: Preston Carrol=
l 
Sent: Friday, March 26, 2010 10:30 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subjec=
t: Re: BlackFortress


  
> "Keep me updated of your progress" said hydras =
by comlink

"Yes Sir." Cyclonus said in reply on the comlink as he entered =
the
research center that Hydras had wanted him to secure. It was a mass of
=
computer banks and relays, observation rooms, medical beds and a host
of ot=
her things. Cyclonus took a moment to look around, Rodimus
comming in right=
 behind him.

Rodimus glowered, obviously unhappy about being here, and bei=
ng
ordered about by Cyclonus, his fists were balled and his stride was
agre=
ssive and quick.

Cyclonus looked over at him, his optics never really leav=
ing the more
excitable mech. "I have given you all that you need to know ab=
out the
Ark." Cyclonus said, his voice calm and unruffled, sounding like he=

was talking about the weather rather than worrying about wether
Rodimus wo=
uld attack him or not. "I'm sure Hydras could use you in the
security secti=
on with him."

Rodimus nodded, "Yes, RIGHT!" he said as he glanced around t=
he room,
as if he didn't quite trust Cyclonus. "But if you betray us, then =
you
will have to answer to ME!" He said, his voice all agression and anger
=
again.

Cyclonus turned to face Rodimus fully, "Of course." he said, his fa=
ce
still calm, although there was a trace of something that flitted
across =
his face for a moment - anger? annoyance? humor? It was
difficult to tell. =
"I would expect nothing less of you." Cyclonus said
as he pointedly turned =
his back to Rodimus, a dismissal of a sort.

Rodimus just glared at Cyclonu=
s, and for a long moment considered
taking out his gun and just blasting th=
e ex-minion in the back. But
finally he just shook his head and left the ro=
om, the door slamming
shut behind him.

Cylonus just shook his head, a slig=
ht smile appearing on his face,
"Perhaps there is hope for the boy yet." he=
 said as he began work on
upgrading the security of the room.

Preston
